title: AdCP Schema Registry v1
description: Registry of all AdCP JSON schemas for validation and discovery

versioning.note: AdCP uses path-based versioning. The schema URL path (/schemas/) indicates the version. Individual request/response schemas do NOT include adcp_version fields. Compatibility follows semantic versioning rules.

core.description: Core data models used throughout AdCP

package.description: A specific product within a media buy (line item)

creative-asset.description: Creative asset for upload to library - supports static assets, generative formats, and third-party ad serving (VAST, DAAST, HTML, JavaScript)

account.description: Billing account representing who pays for advertising. Accounts have rate cards, payment terms, and platform mappings.

format.description: Represents a creative format with its requirements

measurement.description: Measurement capabilities included with a product

creative-policy.description: Creative requirements and restrictions for a product

pagination-request.description: Standard cursor-based pagination parameters for list request schemas

pagination-response.description: Standard cursor-based pagination metadata for list response schemas

creative-assignment.description: Assignment of a creative asset to a package

creative-manifest.description: Complete specification of a creative with all assets needed for rendering

performance-feedback.description: Performance feedback data for a media buy or package

creative-variant.description: A specific execution variant of a creative with performance metrics

property.description: An advertising property that can be validated via adagents.json

brand-manifest.description: Standardized brand information manifest for creative generation and media buying

brand-manifest-ref.description: Brand manifest reference (inline object or URL)

creative-brief.description: Campaign-level creative context for AI-powered creative generation

creative-brief-ref.description: Creative brief reference (inline object or URL)

reference-asset.description: A reference asset with semantic role for creative context

promoted-products.description: Product or offering selection for campaigns with multiple selection methods

proposal.description: A proposed media plan with budget allocations across products - actionable via create_media_buy

product-allocation.description: A budget allocation for a specific product within a proposal

delivery-forecast.description: Forecasted delivery metrics for a proposal or product allocation

forecast-range.description: A forecast value with optional low/high bounds

forecast-point.description: A single point on a budget-to-outcome curve

promoted-offerings.description: Complete offering specification combining brand manifest, product selectors, and asset filters

offering.description: A promotable offering from a brand with optional SI endpoint for conversational experiences

start-timing.description: Campaign start timing: 'asap' or ISO 8601 date-time

pricing-option.description: A pricing model option offered by a publisher for a product

protocol-envelope.description: Standard envelope structure added by protocol layer (MCP, A2A, REST) that wraps task response payloads with protocol-level fields like status, context_id, task_id, and message

placement.description: Represents a specific ad placement within a product's inventory

mcp-webhook-payload.description: MCP-specific webhook payload structure for HTTP-based push notifications. Protocol-level fields at top-level (task_id, status, etc.) and AdCP data layer nested under 'result'. NOT used in A2A (uses native statusUpdate).

destination.description: A destination platform where signals can be activated (DSP, sales agent, etc.)

deployment.description: A signal deployment to a specific destination platform with activation status and key

publisher-property-selector.description: Selects properties from a publisher's adagents.json - supports three patterns: all properties, specific IDs, or by tags

creative-filters.description: Filter criteria for querying creative assets from the centralized library

signal-filters.description: Filters to refine signal discovery results

property-id.description: Identifier for a publisher property - lowercase alphanumeric with underscores only

property-tag.description: Tag for categorizing publisher properties - lowercase alphanumeric with underscores only

property-list-ref.description: Reference to an externally managed property list for passing large property sets

identifier.description: A property identifier with type and value

media-buy-features.description: Optional media-buy protocol features for capability declarations and product filters

brand-id.description: Identifier for a brand within a house portfolio - lowercase alphanumeric with underscores only

brand-ref.description: Reference to a brand via house domain + brand_id (like publisher + property_id)

signal-id.description: Universal signal identifier - discriminated union by source: 'catalog' (data_provider_domain + id, verifiable) or 'agent' (agent_url + id, trust-based)

signal-definition.description: Signal definition published in a data provider's adagents.json catalog

data-provider-signal-selector.description: Selects signals from a data provider's adagents.json - supports three patterns: all signals, specific IDs, or by tags

daypart-target.description: A time window for daypart targeting with days of week and hour range

signal-targeting.description: Targeting constraint for a signal - discriminated union by value_type (binary, categorical, numeric)

event.description: A marketing event (conversion, engagement, or custom) for attribution

user-match.description: User identifiers for attribution matching (UIDs, hashed identifiers, click IDs)

event-custom-data.description: Event-specific data for attribution and reporting

attribution-window.description: Attribution methodology and lookback windows for conversion measurement

optimization-goal.description: Conversion optimization goal for a package - event source, event type, target ROAS/CPA, and attribution window

confidence-interval.description: Statistical confidence interval for measurement results (Bayesian credible or frequentist)

tracker.description: Tracking URL provided by a measurement agent

results-delivery.description: Configuration for measurement results delivery (webhook and/or polling)

measurement-metric.description: Individual metric result from a measurement agent with confidence and interpretation

data-transport.description: Data transport configuration for exposure data delivery (discriminated union by type)

readiness.description: Readiness assessment for measurement â€” blockers, data coverage, estimated ready date

exposure-event.description: Standardized advertising exposure event for delivery to measurement agents

measurement-capabilities.description: Capabilities declared by a measurement agent (campaign and channel measurement)

channel-reallocation.description: Budget reallocation recommendation from channel-level measurement (MMM)

requirements.description: Typed requirement schemas for creative assets in format definitions

asset-requirements.description: Combined schema that allows any typed asset requirements

html-asset-requirements.description: Requirements for HTML creative assets - sandbox compatibility, external resources, allowed domains

image-asset-requirements.description: Requirements for image creative assets - dimensions, formats, file size, animation

video-asset-requirements.description: Requirements for video creative assets - dimensions, duration, codecs, bitrate

audio-asset-requirements.description: Requirements for audio creative assets - duration, formats, sample rate, channels

javascript-asset-requirements.description: Requirements for JavaScript creative assets - module type, external resources

text-asset-requirements.description: Requirements for text creative assets - character limits, line counts

url-asset-requirements.description: Requirements for URL assets - protocols, allowed domains, macro support

vast-asset-requirements.description: Requirements for VAST creative assets - version requirements

promoted-offerings-asset-requirements.description: Requirements for promoted offerings creative assets

pricing-model.description: Supported pricing models for advertising products

identifier-types.description: Valid identifier types for property identification across different media types

publisher-identifier-types.description: Valid identifier types for publisher/legal entity identification (TAG ID, DUNS, LEI, seller_id, GLN)

channels.description: Advertising channels (display, video, dooh, ctv, audio, etc.)

task-status.description: Standardized task status values based on A2A TaskState enum

task-type.description: Valid AdCP task types across all domains

asset-content-type.description: Types of content that can be used as creative assets (image, video, html, etc.)

format-category.description: High-level categories for creative formats (audio, video, display, native, dooh, rich_media, universal)

vast-tracking-event.description: Standard VAST tracking events for video playback and interaction

property-type.description: Types of advertising properties (website, mobile_app, ctv_app, dooh, podcast, radio, streaming_audio)

dimension-unit.description: Units of measurement for creative format dimensions (px, dp, inches, cm)

co-branding-requirement.description: Co-branding policy for creatives (required, optional, none)

landing-page-requirement.description: Landing page policy for creative destinations (any, retailer_site_only, must_include_retailer)

daast-tracking-event.description: Standard DAAST tracking events for audio playback and interaction

day-of-week.description: Days of the week for daypart targeting

signal-catalog-type.description: Types of signal catalogs (marketplace, custom, owned)

metric-type.description: Performance metric types for feedback and optimization

forecast-method.description: Method used to produce a delivery forecast (estimate, modeled, guaranteed)

forecastable-metric.description: Standard metric names for delivery forecasts (audience_size, reach, impressions, clicks, spend, etc.)

forecast-range-unit.description: How to interpret forecast points: spend curve, reach/frequency curve, temporal (weekly/daily), or outcome targets (clicks/conversions)

demographic-system.description: Audience measurement systems for demographic notation (nielsen, barb, agf, oztam, mediametrie, custom)

reach-unit.description: Unit of measurement for reach metrics (individuals, households, devices, accounts, cookies, custom)

creative-agent-capability.description: Capabilities supported by creative agents (validation, assembly, generation, preview, delivery)

adcp-domain.description: AdCP protocol domains (media-buy, signals, governance, creative, measurement)

http-method.description: HTTP methods for webhook requests (GET, POST)

webhook-response-type.description: Expected response content types from webhooks

javascript-module-type.description: JavaScript module format types (esm, commonjs, script)

url-asset-type.description: Types of URL assets (clickthrough, tracker_pixel, tracker_script)

creative-action.description: Actions taken on creatives during sync (created, updated, unchanged, failed, deleted)

notification-type.description: Types of delivery notifications (scheduled, final, delayed, adjusted)

reporting-frequency.description: Frequencies for delivery reports (hourly, daily, monthly)

available-metric.description: Standard delivery and performance metrics for reporting

preview-output-format.description: Output formats for creative previews (url, html)

sort-direction.description: Sort direction for list queries (asc, desc)

history-entry-type.description: Type of task history entry (request, response)

creative-sort-field.description: Fields available for sorting creative listings

geo-level.description: Geographic targeting granularity levels (country, region, metro, postal_area)

metro-system.description: Metro area classification systems for geographic targeting (nielsen_dma, uk_itl1, uk_itl2, eurostat_nuts2)

postal-system.description: Postal code systems for geographic targeting. System names encode country and precision (us_zip, gb_outward, ca_fsa, etc.)

age-verification-method.description: Methods for verifying user age for compliance (facial_age_estimation, id_document, digital_id, credit_card, world_id)

device-platform.description: Operating system platforms for device targeting. Browser values from Sec-CH-UA-Platform standard, extended for CTV

signal-value-type.description: Signal value types for targeting (binary, categorical, numeric)

signal-source.description: Source type for signal identifiers: 'catalog' (verifiable via data provider) or 'agent' (trust-based)

universal-macro.description: Standardized macro placeholders for dynamic value substitution in creative tracking URLs

event-type.description: Standard marketing event types for conversion tracking (purchase, lead, add_to_cart, etc.)

uid-type.description: Universal ID types for user matching (rampid, id5, uid2, maid, etc.)

action-source.description: Where the conversion event originated (website, app, offline, etc.)

attribution-model.description: Attribution model used for conversion measurement

wcag-level.description: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines conformance level (A, AA, AAA)

promoted-offerings-requirement.description: Content requirements that a creative format can impose on promoted offerings

measurement-methodology.description: Methodologies used by measurement agents (mmm, mta, incrementality_test, etc.)

measurement-metric-type.description: Metric types produced by measurement agents (roi, mroi, cpik, channel_contribution, etc.)

data-transport-type.description: Transport mechanisms for exposure data delivery (snowflake_share, cloud_bucket, direct_api, polling, provider_managed)

measurement-reporting-cadence.description: Reporting frequency for measurement agents (daily, weekly, on_model_refresh)

tracker-type.description: Types of tracking pixels or URLs (click, impression, viewability)

media-buy-sync-action.description: Action taken on a media buy during measurement registration (created, updated, unchanged, failed)

measurement-status.description: Lifecycle status of a media buy within a measurement agent

readiness-blocker.description: Machine-readable codes for issues preventing measurement readiness

confidence-interval-method.description: Statistical method used to compute a confidence interval (bayesian_credible, frequentist_confidence)

exposure-event-type.description: Types of advertising exposure events (impression, click, conversion)

measurement-scope.description: Scope of measurement results (campaign or channel)

pricing-options.description: Individual pricing model schemas. Discriminated by pricing_model field. If fixed_price is present, it's fixed pricing. If absent, it's auction-based (floor_price and price_guidance optional).

cpm-option.description: Cost Per Mille (CPM) pricing - supports fixed rate and auction modes

vcpm-option.description: Viewable Cost Per Mille (vCPM) pricing - supports fixed rate and auction modes

cpc-option.description: Cost Per Click (CPC) pricing - supports fixed rate and auction modes

cpcv-option.description: Cost Per Completed View (CPCV) pricing - supports fixed rate and auction modes

cpv-option.description: Cost Per View (CPV) pricing with threshold - supports fixed rate and auction modes

cpp-option.description: Cost Per Point (CPP) pricing for TV/audio with demographic measurement - supports fixed rate and auction modes

cpa-option.description: Cost Per Acquisition (CPA) pricing for performance campaigns - fixed price per conversion event

flat-rate-option.description: Flat rate pricing for DOOH and sponsorships - supports fixed rate and auction modes

time-option.description: Time-based pricing - cost per time unit (hour, day, week, month) that scales with campaign duration

request.description: Request parameters for listing accounts accessible to the authenticated agent
Request parameters for syncing advertiser accounts with upsert semantics

package-request.description: Package configuration for media buy creation - used within create_media_buy request

package-update.description: Package update configuration for update_media_buy - identifies package and specifies fields to modify

request.description: Request parameters for discovering available advertising products
Request parameters for discovering format IDs and creative agents supported by this sales agent

response.description: Response payload with format_ids and creative_agents list. Sales agent returns which formats it supports and which creative agents provide those formats. Buyers query creative agents for full format specifications.

request.description: Request parameters for creating a media buy
Request parameters for syncing creative assets with upsert semantics
Request parameters for querying creative library with filtering and pagination
Request parameters for updating campaign and package settings
Request parameters for retrieving comprehensive delivery metrics
Request parameters for sharing performance outcomes with publishers
Request parameters for configuring event sources on an account
Request parameters for logging conversion or marketing events

creative.description: Creative protocol task request/response schemas and asset type definitions

request.description: Request parameters for AI-powered creative generation
Request parameters for generating creative previews
Request parameters for discovering creative formats from this creative agent

response.description: Response payload with full format definitions - this is the authoritative source for format specifications

request.description: Request parameters for retrieving creative delivery data with variant-level breakdowns

response.description: Response payload with creative delivery data including variant manifests and metrics

asset_types.description: Asset type definitions for creative manifests

request.description: Request parameters for discovering signals based on description
Request parameters for activating a signal on a specific platform/account

governance.description: Governance protocol for property governance, brand standards, content standards, and compliance

property-feature-definition.description: Definition of a feature that a governance agent can evaluate

property-feature.description: A discrete feature assessment for a property

feature-requirement.description: A feature-based requirement for property filtering

property-error.description: Error information for a property that could not be evaluated

property-list.description: A managed property list with optional filters for dynamic evaluation

property-list-filters.description: Filters that dynamically modify a property list when resolved

property-list-changed-webhook.description: Webhook payload when a property list changes

base-property-source.description: A source of properties for a property list - supports publisher+tags, publisher+property_ids, or direct identifiers

content-standards.description: Reusable content standards configuration - defines brand safety/suitability policies with scope, policy, calibration exemplars, and lifecycle dates

content-standards-artifact.description: Content artifact for evaluation or calibration - represents content context where ad placements occur, identified by property_id + artifact_id

artifact-webhook-payload.description: Webhook payload for content artifact delivery from sales agents to orchestrators

request.description: Request parameters for creating a new property list
Request parameters for updating an existing property list
Request parameters for retrieving a property list with resolved properties
Request parameters for listing property lists
Request parameters for deleting a property list
Request parameters for listing content standards configurations

response.description: Response payload with list of content standards configurations

request.description: Request parameters for retrieving a specific standards configuration

response.description: Response payload with full standards configuration including policy and calibration data

request.description: Request parameters for creating a new content standards configuration
Request parameters for updating an existing content standards configuration
Request parameters for collaborative calibration dialogue

response.description: Response payload with detailed explanations for policy alignment

request.description: Request parameters for batch validating delivery records

response.description: Response payload with batch validation results

request.description: Request parameters for retrieving content artifacts from a media buy

response.description: Response payload with content artifacts for validation

measurement.description: Measurement protocol for campaign-level and channel-level measurement capabilities

request.description: Request parameters for registering media buys with a measurement agent
Request parameters for retrieving measurement results (campaign or channel scope)

protocol.description: Protocol-level tasks that work across all AdCP domain protocols

request.description: Request parameters for cross-protocol capability discovery

response.description: Response payload for get_adcp_capabilities task - includes AdCP version, supported protocols, and protocol-specific capabilities (media_buy, signals, etc.)

sponsored-intelligence.description: Sponsored Intelligence Protocol for conversational brand experiences in AI assistants

si-capabilities.description: Capability categories that brand or host can support (modalities, components, commerce)

si-identity.description: User identity with explicit consent for personalized brand experiences

si-ui-element.description: Standard visual components (text, link, image, product_card, carousel, action_button, app_handoff)

request.description: Get offering details, availability, and optionally matching products before session handoff

response.description: Offering details, availability status, matching products, and token for session correlation

request.description: Host initiates SI session with brand agent - includes context, identity, and capability negotiation

response.description: Brand agent's response with session ID, initial message, UI elements, and negotiated capabilities

request.description: Send a message within an active SI session

response.description: Brand agent's response to the message, including session status and potential handoff

request.description: Terminate an SI session with reason (handoff_transaction, handoff_complete, user_exit, session_timeout, host_terminated)

response.description: Termination confirmation with optional ACP handoff or follow-up data

adagents.description: Agent authorization file format specification for publishers and data providers
adagents.purpose: Declares authorized agents. Publishers use it for sales agent authorization over properties. Data providers use it to publish signal catalogs and authorize signals agents to resell their data.

brand.description: Brand identity claim file format specification
brand.purpose: Declares brand identity and agent for a domain, enabling brand discovery and verification

extensions.description: Typed extension schemas for vendor-specific or domain-specific data. Extensions define the structure of data within the ext.{namespace} field. Agents declare which extensions they support in their agent card.

registry.description: Auto-generated registry of all available extensions with metadata

meta.description: Schema that all extension files must follow. Defines valid_from, valid_until, and extension data structure.

usage.validation: Use these schemas to validate AdCP requests and responses
usage.codeGeneration: Generate client SDKs using these schemas

examples.code: const Ajv = require('ajv'); const ajv = new Ajv(); const schema = require('./schemas/core/product.json'); const validate = ajv.compile(schema);
